page.title: 09Gt.Waldingfield Farming 1
page.content: Virtually all of the undeveloped land in the village is farmed.A high proportion of this is owned by the county council and leased to farmers. Mr.Owen Kiddy leases 37 hectares which he farms with his son.His main crop is wheat,most of which either goes into the grain store on the airfield,(q.v.), or used in the production of dog meal in nearby Gt.Cornard.As a break, (rotation), crop he now grows oil seed rape or sugar beet.Mr.Kiddy also rears about 1200 turkeys each year for the Christmas trade,and fattens about 10 bullocks each year.
